jobsJson.descriptionPlain:
People in GOJEK are not necessarily the best people from reputable universities. We welcome everyone with an immense passion to learn, high resilience and fun at the same time. It is our job being part of GO-TROOPS to challenge, support and inspire one another because we only get better because of one another. We know that changing the world is hard work, we want to make sure we LOVE the people we work with.

This role will be responsible towards high-risk cases prevention, mitigation, and handling throughout GoLife services.

jobsJson.additionalPlain:
Gojek is a technology startup based in Jakarta, Indonesia. Specialising in ride-hailing and logistics, we are also the only company in Southeast Asia to be part of Fortune's 50 Companies That Changed the World (2017).

Gojek is a Super App: one app with over 20 services including food delivery, commuting, digital payments, shopping, hyper-local delivery, massages, and many more.

Gojek is Indonesia’s first and fastest growing unicorn building an on-demand empire. Our total of 2,000,000 driver-partners collectively travel 16.5 million KM daily – making us Indonesia’s de-facto transportation choice.

Gojek is a verb! Gojek is a way of life!

• To serve as the primary focal point of safety and security for service providers;
  • To lead and manage the team who runs on-the-ground investigations and corrective action;
  • To create strategic planning on all safety and security related matters, including prevention, crisis and contingency planning;
  • To investigate all safety, security and risk management related issues;
  • To conduct training needs assessment with key stakeholders resulting in increased safety, security and risk management capacity;
  • To be able to mitigate any safety and security related issues;
  • To collaborate across multiple functions internally to ensure that GoLife operations and business meet all local laws and regulations;
  • To liaise and coordinate with local government institutions;
  • To develop and update security plans, business continuity plans and crisis management plans, and policies and procedures, in accordance with best practices and ensure their implementation.

• Bachelor’s degree in Criminology, Security Administration or related area or ability to demonstrate a work-based equivalent;
  • A solid 6 years of experience, with 3 years experience as a Head of Safety and Security in FMCG companies, Oil and Gas, Startups, etc.;
  • Experienced in collaborations with authorities and government institutions;
  • Driven, and strong leadership skills;
  • Robust communication skills;
  • Motivated self starter, attention to detail, problem-solving aptitude, agile and able to work quickly in a constantly evolving competitive landscape.
